message: Ooh. Oooooh!

replies.text: Hey, what's the matter with you?

message: I feel so bad.

replies.text: Looks like a bit fever. Just stay in bed for a few days.

message: But I can't! I mustn't! Gnossath would kill me.

replies.text: Gnossath would kill you? Why?

message: I am working for him.

replies.text: N

message: He had lent me money, so that I could afford this house. But no work - no money. I fear that Gnossath would take my house, if I can't pay my debts.

replies.text: Maybe I could help you? I could do your work.
That's the way it goes, man. Have a nice day.

message: You would do that? Oh, thank you! Thank you!

replies.text: And you - get healthy again!.
I have too good a heart.

message: Did you talk to Gnossath?

replies.text: Not yet.

message: Did you talk to Gnossath?

replies.text: Yes. He wants me to carry heavy boulders.

message: Did you start working already?

replies.text: Yes. It is hard work, really.

message: Thank you for your help!

replies.text: Was a pleasure.

message: Hey kid! Come and have a drink with me!

replies.text: No, thank you.
I thought you were ill?

message: I am still - just taking my medicine here.
The door is locked.
Who are you? Stebbarik, my husband, is not at home.

replies.text: N

message: Not at home, no. He never is.

replies.text: N

message: Hey kid! Come and have a drink with me!

replies.text: No, thank you.

message: Hey, kid! I am waiting for Stebbarik. Have you seen him?

replies.text: No. What do you want of him?

message: He has to work for me. I hope for him, that he will appear soon.

replies.text: N

message: You could do me a favour, if you'd find him.
Have you seen this lazy bone, Stebbarik?

replies.text: Stebbarik is ill at home. He is very anxious that you might get angry.

message: Ill? Rats! Who will repair the dam now? It must be done soon.

replies.text: If it is so important, maybe I can help?

message: You? A kid? It is too heavy work. We need 50 big boulders carried from the stock to the dam here.

replies.text: Sounds easy. Let me try it.
You are right. This is no work for me.

message: OK. Try, if you want. The pile of boulders is just next to the wooden logs over there.

replies.text: Aye.

message: But beware, they are really heavy.
Where are the boulders? I knew it would be too heavy for you.

replies.text: Just you wait.

message: You have carried some boulders already - good. Just do the rest too.

replies.text: Aye.

message: Thanks again for your good work. Are you sure you don't want a job?

replies.text: Certainly not. I am on a mission of Mikhail.

message: Breathing heavily under the big load, you collapse, losing all the boulders.
You can't carry so many boulders.
Hey, where are you going? Bring the boulders to the dam!
Hands off! These boulders are needed for the dam!
Take a boulder?

replies.text: Ah, no. This would be too much.
Yes.
No.

message: Uff, that's heavy!

replies.text: Take another one.
And now to the dam.

message: You throw the boulder into the water, just before the dam.

replies.text: N

message: You throw 2 boulders into the water, just before the dam.

replies.text: N

message: You throw 3 boulders into the water, just before the dam.

replies.text: Uff.

message: You throw 4 boulders into the water, just before the dam.

replies.text: Uff. They somehow seem to get heavier and heavier.

message: You have brought already more than 5 boulders.
Over 10 boulders.
At least 15 boulders now.
Only a few boulders left.
Wow, you got it.

replies.text: My arms are longer now...

message: I am really impressed. You have done four times as much as Stebbarik. So tell him, that he could stay home this week and get cured again.

replies.text: He will be very relieved.

message: Hush! You are chasing the fish away!
Oops - the water is pouring rather fast!
I'm drinking because I hate myself...
I hate myself, because I'm drinking...
I'm coming, just a second...
Hello again. Can you please help me to find my sister Juttarka?

replies.text: I found a statue looking almost like a real woman. [Describe the statue to Anakis]
Yes, I will search for your sister.
No, that's none of my business.

message:
Hello my name is Anakis. I hope you can you help me. 

Yesterday my sister Juttarka left the city to go up to this hill. She did not come home and now I am searching for her. I fear she went into that cave.

replies.text: I found a statue looking almost like a real woman. [Describe the statue to Anakis]
Yes, I will search for your sister.
No, that's none of my business.

message:
Thank you. My sister has long hair and is wearing a long skirt.

Please take care. Fangwurm the priest of western Brimhaven told us about a Basilisk in the cave that will turn you to stone when you go near him an your eyes meet its eyes.
Did you find my sister?

replies.text: No, not yet.
I only found a stone statue looking almost like a real woman. [Describe the statue to Anakis]

message:
Oh no, that's her! Thank you for helping me to find out what happened to her. 

I think it was the Basilisk, who did that to her.

replies.text: N

message: Can you find the Basilisk and kill it? But take care that no the same fate befells you, that happened to my sister.

replies.text: I already found the Basilisk and killed it.
I will take revenge for your sister and find a way to kill that Basilisk.
I will take revenge, but let me first think if it is possible to help your sister.
No, that's too dangerous for me.

message: Did you kill the Basilisk?

replies.text: I found the Basilisk and killed it, but I decided to take the blood for myself.
I found the Basilisk and killed it.
I found no way to help your sister, but I took revenge and killed the Basilisk.
No, not yet.
I will take revenge, but let me first think if it is possible to help your sister.

message: Thank you for taking revenge for Juttarka. I will go now and morn for my sister.

replies.text: N

message: Thank you so much for rescuing my sister Juttarka. She just came out of the cave and told me what you did for her. I will now go home, too.

replies.text: N

message: Oh no. Why did you not even try to help her? Now i will go and morn for my sister.

replies.text: N

message: This stone statue looks almost like a real woman.

With a huge effort you go neaer to the Basilisk and he is looking right into your eyes.

When you feel that can't move any more and your heartbeat drops... 
...while you are slowly turning to stone.
You killed the Basilisk and the blood flows out of its wounds.

replies.text: I use the crystal vial and pour the blood over the stone statue.
I keep the blood for myself using the empty crystal vial.

message:
Slowly the stone statue gets colorful and starts to move. You healed the woman!

After she is back to life, she thanks you and tells you, that she is Anakis' sister Juttarka.

She will leave the cave now and meet her waiting brother.
There is only some dried up blood on the ground left.
Thank you for saving my life. Please come back to me when you are some years older..

replies.text: It was a pleasure for me.

message: Thank you for trying to help my sister. I am so sad.
Thank you so much for helping my sister Juttarka. We are all very happy.
Go away. I don't want to talk to people like you.
Yes, I have some crystal vials. I can sell you one for 50 gold pieces.

replies.text: That is too expensive for me.
I take one.

message: Here is your crytsal vial. Thanks for the 50 gold pieces.

replies.text: N

message:
The Basilisks blood is magical. It can protect against damage if applied to the skin. Fresh and warm Basilisks blood might even heal a person turned to stone.
But how can you kill a Basilisk if you can't look at it? This is a strong defense.

replies.text: I already killed the Basilisk.
You are right, it will not be possible to kill the Basilisk.
I will find a way to kill the Basilisk.

message: Do you think it is possbile to help her? Maybe Fangwurm the priest of western Brimhaven has some information.
Juttarka told me, that you saved her life. Thank you. May the shadow always be with you.
I am sad, that you took the blood for yourself instead of trying to help Anakis' sister. Please leave now.
Thank you for killing the Basilisk, but you should better have talked to me before killing it, because its magical blood is now dried up and vasted. May the shadow always be with you.
May the shadow be with you.

replies.text: I killed the Basilisk and took the blood for myself.
I killed the Basilisk in the cave.
Can you please tell me again, what you know about the Basilisks blood?
I believe that Anakis' sister was turned to stone by the Basilisk in the cave. Do you have any idea if I could help her?
Anakis' sister is missing. Can you tell me more about the Basilisk in the cave.

message:
You would need a special crystal vial that is resistent to the Basilisks blood to handle it. The potion maker in Fallhaven might sell them. 
May the shadow be with you.
The Basilisk will turn you to stone when you go near him an your eyes meet its eyes. You should not look at it. Come back to me if you know what happened to Anakis' sister.
Anakis told me that you took the blood for yourself instead of trying to help his sister. Please leave now.

Anakis told me that you killed the Basilisk. Thank you, but you should better have talked to me before killing it, because its magical blood is now dried up and vasted. May the shadow always be with you.
You see an old Basilisk at the end of the room that glances at you. With a feeling of deadly danger your movements gets slower the nearer you go.
Stop, you are not allowed to go any further.
